author: adityapatwardhan
body:
On RHEL 7.2 WSMan remoting does not work. It does not find the WSMan client library.
It works for other distros like Debian 8.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
 $session = New-PSSession -URI $uri -ConfigurationName Microsoft.Exchange -Credential $cred -Authentication Basic -AllowRedirection
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
Connection succeeds
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
New-PSSession : This parameter set requires WSMan, and no supported WSMan client library was found. WSMan is either not installed or unavailable for this system.
At line:1 char:12
+ $session = New-PSSession -URI $uri -ConfigurationName Microsoft.Excha ...
+            ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : ResourceUnavailable: (:) [New-PSSession], PSRemotingTransportException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.Management.Automation.Remoting.PSRemotingDataStructureException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.NewPSSessionCommand
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.4
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.4
OS                             Linux 3.10.0-862.3.2.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue May 15 18:22:15 EDT 2018
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

```

comments.author: dantraMSFT
comments.body:
The underlying problem is the links for libcrypto.so.1.0.0 and libssl.so.1.0.0 were not created by package.psm1.  This occurs when building directly on redhat; something we typically do not do; we build on Centos and use it on redhat.  See the logic for setting `IsRedHatFamily` in [Get-EnvironmentInformation](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/791159d615adf6cdeb67940413d2e96ea0c61274/build.psm1#L100)
A possible fix is to add  an explicit IsRedHat variable and detection then update `IsRedHatFamily` to include it in the decision.

title: New-PSSession does not find WSMan client library on RHEL72
